Milk is not harmless. 🥛  Here are some things you should know about the dairy industry: 🥛 Cows are forcibly impregnated repeatedly. 🥛 They are separated from their calves, causing both of them extreme distress. 🥛 When they can no longer produce as much milk, the cows are taken to the slaughterhouse. 🥛If their calves cannot be monetized — raised for veal or milk — they are killed at birth. 🐮 It's time to reconsider dairy consumption and explore plant-based alternatives. Choose veganism #ForTheAnimals.  Try vegan with us today at genv.org/go-vegan!

A worker grabs gentle chicks, throwing them into a bucket as if they were inanimate objects. Animal agriculture is industrial cruelty to animals and apathy toward their inherent rights.  Did you know this is how animals are treated for food?🐣

Why keep cruelty on the plate? 🍽️  🐣 In the egg industry, male chicks are nothing more than an unwanted by-product. Besides not laying eggs, they belong to the wrong breed to put on muscle for meat production, hence, they are killed to become feed.  On their first day of life, they are thrown onto an industrial conveyor belt heading towards the grinder—a horrifying machine that crushes them while still alive and fully conscious.  But we can change this. 🌱 Every choice we make contributes to a more compassionate world.  Choose veganism.🐣💛
Animals want to be free, just like us. Animals have families, just like us. Animals have a right to live, just like us.  Video by: vishnu___km
We should never be too busy for compassion. Whenever and wherever we can make the choice, choose vegan.

After minks, foxes are the second most widely farmed species in the fur industry, with an estimated 4 million killed for their pelts each year.  Many species of fox, including the commonly known red fox, live 3-4 years naturally. On fur farms, they are kept in filthy, traumatizing conditions and killed at around 4 months old.  If you wish to see animals free from suffering, consider going vegan. It’s the single biggest thing we can do at an individual level to better the lives of animals.  And, of course, never buy fur.

Between 300 and 620 billion individual shrimps are farmed every year across the globe. 🦐  90% of the shrimp imported into the U.S. are from farms across Southeast Asia, where slavery and human trafficking are commonplace.  A plant-based diet is the best choice for animals, but also for people. Go Vegan! 🌱

Animals feel just like we do. And guess what? This is a scientific fact! 🔬  In July 2012, the Cambridge Declaration on Consciousness was published. An international group of scientists gathered in England to study behaviors related to both human and non-human animals. The evidence indicated that humans are not the only sentient beings.  Animals have the capacity to have conscious experiences, sensations, or perceptions, such as pain, pleasure, and emotions. 🐔🐷🐮  Despite this, we choose to subject them to a life of pain and suffering. But it doesn't have to be this way!  Based on scientific evidence, how about adopting a more humble, empathetic, and loving attitude? 🌍✨  Learn more about sentience on our blog 👇 https://pulse.ly/gdnhjzwl4c

🦁 Myth: Lions eat meat, so humans should too, right? 🍖🤔 Wrong! Just because lions have a carnivorous diet doesn't mean it's the ideal model for humans.  Our bodies are designed to thrive on a plant-based diet, rich in nutrients, fiber, and compassion. Let's break free from such outdated myths and embrace a diet that aligns with our health, the planet, and the welfare of all living beings. 🌱💪

"Vegans eat a lot of soy and that impacts nature and animals." Who's heard this before? 🙋‍♀️  The truth is, a vegan diet is more sustainable and we can prove it! 👇🏿  Each year, the food system kills 80 billion land animals – that is ten times more farmed animals than there are people on the planet.  🔎 And what does that mean? Instead of growing plants to feed 8 billion (humans’) mouths, we are growing food for 80 billion (animals’) mouths. 🤯  🌎If we combine pastures used for grazing with the amount of land used to grow crops for farmed animals’ feed, animal agriculture accounts for 77 percent of global farming land. Meat, eggs, and dairy take up most of the world’s agricultural land but produce just 18 percent of the world’s calories and 37 percent of total protein.  Such a vast waste of feed and land has serious consequences for both the environment and for wild animals.  ⚡ Have you ever stopped to think about this? Let us know in the comments!

Cows produce milk because they are pregnant. When we consume dairy products like milk, cheese, ice cream, and yogurt we are taking away a mother’s milk she made for her baby.  Please consider alternatives to dairy made from cows’ milk so that families are not torn apart.  🎥 Dominion Movement

ARRESTED  Paul Watson, anti-whaling campaigner and founder of Sea Shepherd, has been arrested by Danish authorities on behalf of Japan, which seeks his extradition. The international arrest warrant relates to Watson’s work to counter Japanese whaling, despite these activities being declared illegal by the International Court of Justice.  Paul Watson is a dedicated leader and fierce advocate for marine life. We support his right to protect whales and call for his immediate release from detention.

Paul, a military veteran, was an army paratrooper and a navy bomb disposal diver before an encounter with a 10-foot bullshark changed everything, including his views on conservation and the ethics of eating animals.  Join the movement towards a better planet with plant-based eating! 🌱🌍
💬Check out the compelling perspectives of Joey Carbstrong, Dr. Sailesh Rao, and Dr. Chidi Ngwaba. 🌍✨  This House Would Go Vegan – let the dialogue begin!

Veal meat is the flesh of a baby cow, who has arguably endured more suffering in his short life than many others on our planet may ever endure in a lifetime. It is a controversial meat, whose production is banned in many countries as a result, although this has not ended the suffering and slaughter of millions of baby cows every year.

The cruel practice of live export continues despite numerous countries banning or planning to ban it. Animals are forced onto tight, confining ships and undertake a punishing journey only to be slaughtered when they reach their destination.  No animal should be treated this way. Live exports must be banned everywhere.  📹@Weanimals

Discover the fascinating world of octopuses! 5 curious facts that will surprise you 🐙💡  1️⃣ They have 3 hearts 💓💓💓 2️⃣ They are masters of camouflage, able to change color and texture! 3️⃣ Their brains are distributed throughout their body, even in their tentacles! 4️⃣ They are highly intelligent, capable of opening jars and even escaping from aquariums! 5️⃣ They can regenerate lost tentacles. Yes, they are incredible creatures! ✨  However, industrial fishing threatens the lives of these beings and all marine life. Join us in protecting them. Consider veganism. 🌱  🐙@zola.franco.5

Who else yawned after watching this?  Here are a few facts about owls in case you didn’t know:  1. Owls have incredible night vision and can see in almost complete darkness. 🌙  2. Owls can hear prey hidden under snow. ❄️ Their hearing is that sharp!  3. Owls can rotate their heads up to 270 degrees without moving their bodies. Talk about flexibility! ✨  4. Some owl species can live up to 25 years in the wild! 🎉  5. Owls have three eyelids: one for blinking, one for sleeping, and one for keeping their eyes clean. 👁️  6. Not all owls hoot! Some make other unique sounds like screeches, barks, and whistles. 🔊  Video by: tammy_ascher
